title: Does it really matter what journalists write about the shroud?
post: Dan can this video be fixed for viewing?
author: Annette Cloutier

title: Does it really matter what journalists write about the shroud?
post: The video is a clack marked “this video is private”  cannot watch video.
author: EKMcMahon

title: Does it really matter what journalists write about the shroud?
post: I watched it a few hours ago, so I think the owner must have withdrawn it after seeing it more publicised than he originally envisaged. You didn’t miss much, except that the speaker, one Artisantony, was talking about the neutron-enrichment-due-to-earthquakes hypothesis, showing that news about the shroud does get about, perhaps more widely than we think.
author: Hugh Farey

title: Does it really matter what journalists write about the shroud?
post: Dan would have to request that from the owner.  Does he visit your site, I wonder, Dan?
author: Andy

title: Does it really matter what journalists write about the shroud?
post: I presume from your introduction that his information about the Shroud research is quite incorrect?
author: Andy

title: Does it really matter what journalists write about the shroud?
post: Dan, it does matter because they can convey the latest news in Shroud research to those who are interested and how much this adheres to the truth depends on ethics. And…. as you know, sometimes absolute rubbish has been given attention in the realm of Shroud studies, both in websites and publications, and a journalist is required to draw attention to that. It is a part of the show in the minefield.
author: Louis
